findings.title: Incorrect constructor name allows anyone to become owner
findings.explanation: The function IamMissing is intended to set the contract owner but is not recognized as a constructor in Solidity 0.4.24. As a public function, it can be called by any address after deployment, allowing anyone to take ownership.
findings.fix_suggestion: Rename IamMissing to the reserved keyword constructor (e.g., constructor() public) so it runs only once at deployment, or explicitly initialize owner in a properly named constructor.

unmatched_predictions.title: Incorrect constructor name allows anyone to become owner
